I have been informed by a scientific friend 
that this unfavorable result of Mr Wedgwood’s 
& Sir Humphry Davy’s experiments, was the 
chief cause which discouraged him from 
following up with perseverance, the idea, which 
he had also entertained of fixing the beautiful 
images of the <u>camera obscura <\u> .
And no doubt, when so distinguished an 
experimenter as Sir H. Davy announced 
“that all experiments had proved unsuccessful” 
such a statement was calculated
materially to discourage further inquiry.
The circumstance also, announced by 
Davy, that the paper on which these images 
were depicted, was liable to become entirely 
dark; & that nothing hitherto tried, would 
prevent it; would perhaps have induced 
one to consider the attempt as hopeless -
if I had not (fortunately) before I read it,
already discovered a method of overcoming 
this
